page.title: 09THE HARWICH ELECTRIC PALACE
page.content: THE ELECTRIC PALACE WAS BUILT IN 1911 AND WAS SHUT DOWN IN 1956 AFTER 45 YEARS ONLY INTERRUPTED BY THE 1953 FLOODS. THE VERY FIRST FILM EVER SHOWN WAS THE BATTLE OF TRAFALGAR AND THE DEATH OF NELSON.THE PALACE CLOSED DOWN IN 1956 BECAUSE IT WAS NO LONGER PROFITABLE.IT WAS REOPENED BY THE ELECTRIC PALACE TRUST IN 1980. THE TOP 5 FILMS IN 1984 WERE: 1.ET; 2.ROBIN HOOD; 3.TOOTSIE; 4.SUPERMAN III; 5.GHANDI. THE MOST POPULAR FILMS IN 1984 WERE THE CHILDRENS ONES.THE MOST UNPOPULAR FILM IN 1984 WAS "A MAN FOR ALL SEASONS". LIVE ENTERTAINMENT HAS RANGED FROM ROCK MUSIC TO THE CLASSICAL DRAMA OF CHECKOV.THE DRAMA PRESENTATIONS OF THE DOVERCOURT THEATRE GROUP ARE POPULAR WITH 120 ATTENDING EACH PERFORMANCE.
